Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; exterior: painted decoration consisting of uncertain figure, possibly part of hind leg of a dotted feline with brown dots to right; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: For other Wild Goat Style dotted felines, see Lemos no. 314 from Emporio.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0079) (phase 2)
